intro: Youngia akaoni, commonly known as the Alaska buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and thrives in cool climates. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Youngia akaoni is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
